page.title: 02PARISH CHURCH,MELBOURNE
page.content: MELBOURNE PARISH CHURCH IS ONE OF THE MOST BEAUTIFUL HISTORICAL BUILDINGS IN THE TOWN.I GO THERE EVERY SUNDAY AS I AM AN ACOLYTE,THAT IS A BOY WHO CARRIES A CANDLE FOR THE VICAR.THE CHURCH IS DEDICATED TO ST. MICHAEL AND ST.MARY.IT WAS BUILT IN 1133 BY THE BISHOP OF CARLISLE.YOU ARE PROBABLY WONDERING WHY THIS BISHOP BUILT A CHURCH IN A SMALL VILLAGE OF ABOUT 200 PEOPLE.WELL,THE SCOTS KEPT COMING DOWN TO ATTACK CARLISLE AND SO HE MOVED SOUTH OF THE RIVER TRENT FOR SAFETY.IT IS A VERY LARGE NORMAN CHURCH,IN FACT A MINI-CATHEDRAL,FIT FOR A BISHOP.IT IS SAID TO HAVE THE FINEST NORMAN DOORWAY AT THE WEST END AND IS THE ONLY PARISH CHURCH IN ENGLAND TO HAVE A CLERESTORY THAT CAN BE WALKED AROUND COMPLETELY.THE FONT IS FROM THE 12TH.CENTURY.THE PRESENT VICAR IS THE REVEREND FREDERICK ROSS.
